授業目的:
This course is designed to give students a general understanding of the different Asian financial markets and institutions. We will also discuss the financial assets traded in these markets, the financial services and instruments these institutions offer, and the mechanisms and characteristics influencing these assets and instruments' value. Some of these details can be country-specific. For the topics whose cross-country differences are important, we will combine a generic description that applies internationally with context-specific discussions focused on Japan, China, Hong Kong, and Singapore.
1.To acquire an internalization of knowledge of Asian financial markets;
2.To keep abreast of global developments and adapt to changing financial market trends;
3.To develop cross-cultural awareness and understand the importance of future innovative trends in the Asian financial services industry.
到達目標:
ILO 1: To apply the traditional and new analysis of the financial market to the East Asian economies and the region as a whole
ILO 2: To familiarize students with the use of Asian financial market, investment, capital funding, and economic development data to Asian businesses and the region as a whole
ILO 3: To familiarize students with the institutional features of various Asian countries and develop a global and regional outlook

By the end of this course, you’ll be able to define and evaluate Asian financial markets, understand the evolution of market trends, identify the benefits of global strategy for your company, and quantify economic and financial market trends in major Asian financial centers.
